official_title: A bill to amend section 5545 of title 5, United States Code, to provide additional pay for certain hazardous duties performed by Federal employees.
short_title: Federal Employee Hazardous Duty Minimum Pay Adjustment Act

summary.text: Federal Employee Hazardous Duty Minimum Pay Adjustment Act - Provides that Federal employees required to perform any portion of their duties within the boundaries of a locality, area, or safety buffer zone determined to be unsafe for human habitation due to the presence of explosive, incendiary, or toxic material shall be entitled to additional pay at the rate of 25 percent of their rate of basic pay. Provides that such additional pay shall be regarded as basic pay for all purposes. Provides that the provisions of this Act shall not be construed as denying the payment of an additional differential beyond the 25 percent authorized in this Act for specific hazards which the Federal employees may undergo directly incident to the performance of their specific duties within the boundaries of such locality, area, or safety buffer zone.
